doc.previous: Habr consolidated his dictatorship through a power system that relied on corruption and violence with thousands of people estimated to have been killed under his rule 21 22 The president favoured his own Daza ethnic group and discriminated against his former allies the Zaghawa His general Idriss D by overthrew him in 1990 23 Attempts to prosecute Habr led to his placement under house arrest in Senegal in 2005 in 2013 Habr was formally charged with war crimes committed during his rule 24
doc.after: D by attempted to reconcile the rebel groups and reintroduced multiparty politics Chadians approved a new constitution by referendum and in 1996 D by easily won a competitive presidential election He won a second term five years later 25 Oil exploitation began in Chad in 2003 bringing with it hopes that Chad would at last have some chances of peace and prosperity Instead internal dissent worsened and a new civil war broke out D by unilaterally modified the constitution to remove the two term limit on the presidency this caused an uproar among the civil society and opposition parties 26
